column4: Hi all. I want to install and start sshd. How do I do this in ubuntu?
How do I install Open-SSH?
sudo apt-get install openssh
then after that, make sure if you're running a firewall that you configure ports right
E: Couldn't find package openssh
Hold up real quick
sudo apt-get install openssh-server
thanks. Now the firewall thing? How do I do that?
Make sure you have port 22 open :P
heh. I know that, but how?
Find another computer, and run ssh user@youripaddress
no no. How do I get to the firewall config?
Are you running a firewall?
isn't there a default one runing?
Shouldn't be, unless you've got a hardware one (your router)
If you want, you could make a test user and I could try to get in
yeah the router I got...damn..no firewall eh.....hmm...damn...fedora was nice for this.
I got computer at home. no worries.
I got computer(s) .so I can test the connection. But the firewall thing is shocking me.
You're fine O_o don't worry about it. If you can't connect from the outside though, you probably should check to make sure you don't have any problems
SSHing works. How do I open close ports in Ubuntu?
